website_summaries.verdict: Experienced campers looking to make their experience more comfortable with a lot of inside space with love this tent.
pros: Can easily fit a queen-sized air mattress and leave plenty of extra space for other gear
Several adults can use this tent comfortably, or a large family
Tent has specially angled windows that let in light and do a great job of keeping out leaks in the rain
Comes in both 6 and 8 man size
cons: Set up on this tent will be a little more complicated than other options on the market

website_summaries.verdict: A spacious, well-built tent that will keep you dry and warm on even the coldest nights.
pros: Fits up to 3 queen size air mattresses
Most adults can stand up comfortably inside
cons: Some have complained that it is not well ventilated

customer_reviews.title: Great for a camp shower or bath, a tent... not so much
customer_reviews.text: Buy this tent only if you are an amphibian or have a strong affinity towards water because if it rains you will get wet. Not just a drip mind you, just your own personal swimming pool. Great if it's a hot afternoon or something it would cool you down. Not 45 degrees out and 2am. See attached video
customer_reviews.author: Reid W

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use again!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! I love it! I (a 29 y/o female) got it up by myself in about 30 minutes- I'm sure someone who puts up tents more frequently could get it up faster though! Went together easily and gave us plenty of room! We had 2 twin air mattresses, 2 folding chairs, a camping table and 2 large dogs with plenty of room to spare! Great purchase! Can't wait to take it out again! Please ignore the messy campsite!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Strong, but not as strong as gravity.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent, will hold up to just about anything. Just about anything. I would not recommend letting a 200+ lb man get completely drunk and fall against the wall of the tent because you will almost certainly break one of the rods and your 200+ lb drunk fiancé will be very very sad about it in the morning. The good news is tho that the sidewall is completely secure, and we stayed completely dry in downpour without even sealing the tent ourselves. Roomy tent, very lovely, just be sure to get a big tarp because it is pretty odd shaped. Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome. Set-up was quick and easy. Family of four fit no problem during our week long camping trip. The LED light was a nice touch. There was some heavy rain one night... Inside was dry. Not the best picture, but helps show the size against the RAM 1500.
customer_reviews.author: DvlMan

customer_reviews.title: Had 7 years and still a great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great. Had it for 7 years and have not had any problems with it. It sturdy well made and lots of room inside. Best purchase I made. Most likely it will last my lifetime. We have not had any leaks. The zippers work fine and little ones can open and close without any problems. The window provided enough ventilation for a tent. We did get snow on one of our trip and between the tent and sleeping bag we did not get cold and slept though the night.
customer_reviews.author: L. Duci

customer_reviews.title: Room for the whole family (and the dog).
customer_reviews.text: Great tent with a LOT of room inside. We put 2 queen blowup mattresses in it and had a ton of extra space (I think we could have fit a third queen mattress in between them). Only took about 30 mins to setup the first time. The only negative is the poles aren’t labeled, nor color coded, so there’s a bit of guess and check to find the right poles (but fairly easy if you are familiar with setting up a tent).
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: The poles are way too flimsy... not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this tent. The quality of the actual tent was great! It kept us dry and held up in the wind. However, after (a great) night sleep we went to pack it up and although we were taking much care in the "tear down" one of our poles sections shattered and gave my husband an awful sliver... we haven't used it since because we are too worried about something similar happening
customer_reviews.author: Amber Jackman

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: It is good size of tent. Easy to assemble it but the instruction has error on it. On the instruction says Pole E but it is Pole C. I was confused with the error. After the first night, one of the poles broke.
customer_reviews.author: RFJ

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I did a lot of research before choosing the Montana Elite. I decided to purchase this based off its reviews and purchased it from amazon because of price. Set up is easy with a helper and can be done by yourself. Instructions attached to the carry bag. I am impressed with the light that came with it. Lucky for me it rained the very next day and I was able to check for leaks and found none. The tent is very spacious and durable. Please see attached pictures and video of it in the rain. I recommend buying eurmax tent stakes and seam sealer
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: leaked on first use
customer_reviews.text: I guess we were expecting too much from the term "waterproof". we set up this tend in the yard as a trial, and it started to storm. . It turned out to be a good thing because we could test its durability and weatherproofing. Needless to say, cups of water were on the inside by morning. It leaked at the seam all around the tent. the rainfly doesn't not cover the sides all the way to the ground, which is obvious from the picture-turns out this is a major design flaw. Disappointed . we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: becky kooistra

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space, easy set up and teardown, and other features
customer_reviews.text: Just tested this tent out a few weeks ago. First time setting up a tent in my life, got it set up in about 20 minutes by myself using instructions. Plenty of space could easily have space to fit a queen sized double high air mattress on both sizes of the tent and still have plenty of space in the middle to stores your belongings. This was a great tent, easy set up, easy teardown. I like the windows layout allows for a good cross breeze when you want. also has pockets and hooks throughout the inside of the tent. Loved this tent, can’t wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca swoboda

customer_reviews.title: Water in tent. Brand new. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Well this is False: “WEATHERPROOF: Welded corners and inverted seams keep water from getting in; included rainfly offers extra weather protection.” Water came in through the rainfly covering the top of the tent and right through the mesh ceiling on both ends of the tent. The tent’s “double thick” construction didn’t help either because water managed to make its way through the walls of the tent as well. And the water coming in was just from the morning dew. Do Not recommend. Fit two queen sized air mattresses without a problem tho lol
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for size
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of 4. 2 adults and 2 under 6 and love this tent. We used it last weekend to camp in our backyard and the room is amazing!! The kids have their "own" side and daddy and mommy have a huge side as well. This was a great purchase and very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Keepin The Faith

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: I got replacement order. First time set up took more than 30 min and thought it takes more time than I thought. After set up, it seem built well. Inside is spacious with good height clearance. === Old review: The door pole should be two to make D shape. One is short and anther one is longer. I got 3 short one. The door cannot be the proper shape. So I've contacted customer service for the parts. No response for 2 days. I have to return.
customer_reviews.author: CZI

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, not too functional
customer_reviews.text: Directions are not great. Got the tent up fairly easy. It seems to be missing parts where they should go. There’s no hooks by the front door to hold the front of the tent down. The hinged door is nice but because the front of the tent is loose it doesn’t close all the way. I watched s bunch of videos and no one addressed the front door situation. I would not buy this again and honestly I would return I but I bought it in March and never had a chance to put it up so I’m out of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent
customer_reviews.text: We love this tent. Hubby’s parents let us borrow their’s and we liked it so got our own. Haven’t experienced rain yet with it, but it looks like it would be pretty weather proof. We did spray it with weatherproofing spray just in case. Held up to moderate winds. Takes some assembling, about 30 minutes for the two of us. But it’s a nice tent. I like being able to stand in it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hiebert

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: I just received this tent yesterday. My husband and I just finished putting it together in our backyard to make sure everything works well before our camping trip in two weeks. It took longer than expected to put together because the instructions really suck, they even labeled the poles incorrectly in the instructions so if you are a beginner you might run into some issues with this. I will update this review once I get the chance to see how it does in the rain and wind.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: Not weather or water proof day 1
customer_reviews.text: Set up the tent for the first weekend camping a of course it rains. Woke up at 4am to my kids yelling they were getting rained on on the far right side and when I got up noticed my sleeping bag was wet on the far left. It was a simple/easy set up but getting soaked on night one???? Waste of money. Very upset. Two days left of this trip and have to cancel if it rains again.
customer_reviews.author: C.Enos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mistake anyone could make. Avoid for night temperatures of 50 F or less. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Rips in the tent from factory present. NOT A WINTER OR EARLY SPRING TENT even though the name is Montana, which I thought meant cold environment capable. Avoid for less than 50 F nightly temperatures. Prepare to fix rips that may be present from factory.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: 70-80 mph wind
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for camping and wanted enough room for my friends, their first time camping. It comfortably fits 2 queen size beds with plenty of room. We didnt have the rain fly on because we didnt think it was going to rain. On our last night, we heard thunder and quickly rushed to get the rain fly on. It was very easy to put on and we were able to put it up on time before severe thunderstorm came. It lasted through a 70-80 mph wind, no leakage or anything. I would definitely recommend this tent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kym

customer_reviews.title: Great short family trips. Decent keeping out water but does not do good with wind.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water resistant tent. There is still some seepage with heavy rainfall. Not good for windy conditions. First time it was used a pole broke with high wind gusts. 2 years later poles broke under wind gusts. Almost impossible to find the proper replacement parts. Not a bad deal for small family trips with pleasant weather. Not great for long trips with inclement weather. I dont regret the purchase but I'm an avid camper and this tent does not work well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good on paper, bad in reality.
customer_reviews.text: I researched many tents and thought this one would be perfect for my family, but it isn't even close. First off, it is time consuming and cumbersome to set up. Second, it doesn't breathe at all. If it's hot or even just warm, you'll be stuck in a sweltering tent with it only having high windows on each end and one on the door, and no cross breeze at all. Third, the dimensions are horrible. 16' x 7' is really akward, as it is too long, but not wide enough. There are many other tents on the market that are much better.
customer_reviews.author: Liddabet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great. I have only used it in the yard so far and there has been no real rain that it’s had. I did turn in the sprinklers for a “trial” rain and it did well. So hopefully it lasts an all night hard core rain. Size is great for 4 and should work just fine for 6. Ease in setting up and the opening of the door was a smooth zip. Update: great in the rain! Had a storm over the weekend and it was nice and dry. Nothing came in and the door cover even let me leave it open to watch the lightning. Great first camping trip solidified its a 5 star for me!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors rule!

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for families
customer_reviews.text: WE bought this about 2 years ago and has been through pacific northwest weather. It is very spacey and great for families. There is 5 of us we can fit two queen size air mattress on both ends of tent. Even with mattresses we can fit all of our bags and still have a walk way. The only down side is we got flooded in by water that was pooling underneath the tent. So the ground is not water resistant. But all in all still a very good tent. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Cost, room, wind resistance, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Ive been homeless for 18 months in the Colorado desert. I’ve had 7 tents since i started this ordeal. This tent is about the best there is for 3.5 season camping here. Wind is the big tent killer, and Coleman tents stand up to it better than any in this price range. The tent has plenty of room, i can stand to put my pants on, and if the wind pushes it down, the springy poles bring it right back up!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hurford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Easy to setup. Need two people. Easy to put away. Got it to fit back in the bag. Huge inside. Need to swap out the stakes with some heavy duty stakes (seriously why don’t they provide better stakes?!?). Took it camping to the beach and had no issues with rain or moisture getting in. Easily fit two queen size beds inside. Felt solid and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the producers of the product not the Amazon seller and as a warning for buyers. The way they boxed the tent was not thought out. It's in a box, in a box which is wasteful. And in the smaller box instead of placing the polls on top they package everything under the tent pushing it so tightly to the top of the box that the kindergarten scissors, yes you heard me, plastic kindergarten scissors scored the bottom of the tent. Brand new and already a score mark which after just a few uses will become a split in the tent bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for our family
customer_reviews.text: I have used this 2 times now...the first time at a Girl Scout campout and set it up with 2 other moms (was pretty easy) and slept 5 of us in it comfortably. Then we used it in Yosemite and the 4 kids slept in it with PLENTY of room. Great size and I love that you can stand up in it. Makes changing easy!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Camping trip was a total mess, but the tent was easy to put together, easy to move when the neighbors parked inches away! And then withstood the 30 mph winds and rain that just happened to find us! No worries, no wetness and it was actually pretty warm considering how cold it got. Absolutely exactly what it says it is. Totally made the trip!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS TENT. It will definitely break.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this is February and went camping for Labor Day. We arrived, attempted to set it up as soon as we unboxed it, got 2 corners in the ground, went to put in the third and it ripped as soon as I walked away. There was no repairing it so we had to pack it up. From reading all the other reviews, there’s no use in contacting anyone. You will all ways be wrong. Worst $130+ spent. Plus we purchased the extended warranty. Another $12 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M Moore

customer_reviews.title: Low quality - broken tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awful. The first time we took it out, one of the side poles shattered in the middle of the night. We decided to give it the benefit of the doubt and exchange for another one. On our next camping trip when setting up our new tent, one of the pegs that the poles go into ripped off the tent. I missed the return window and now I’m stuck with a broken tent.
customer_reviews.author: Emily O.

customer_reviews.title: Because stupid tent LEAKED from the top
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent a grand total of 3 times. The most recent was this past weekend in the Berkshires (Massachusetts). Pounding rain storm made sleeping impossible. Why? Because stupid tent LEAKED from the top. The fly basically didn't do its job, and water dripped in from about 6 different places, straight onto our air mattresses. It was put up correctly - no issues there. It just didn't defend against rain at all. Various points looked like a faucet you leave on slightly.... dripping steadily..... They should advertise this as a "fair weather only" tent. / Pretty weak, Coleman. I would've expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Bruins #1

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Horribly
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent for the first time and it rained two of the three nights we were there. The tent leaked in four different spots. We just got home, and I had every intention of returning it. However, I just saw that my window for returning it has passed. Great. Now we are stuck with it. I guess we will have to spend more money to get some type of waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: sue tipton

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room inside, but faulty materials and difficult set up.
customer_reviews.text: We were so disappointed when setting this tent up. You insert the poles into these little metal eye hook pieces which makes it so they pop out of the opposite side. The middle of the fabric (where the two poles cross over) ripped when inserting the second cross over pole. The two side arched poles were difficult to set up and one of the poles snapped. What we really liked about the tent was that the zippers seemed well made, and the room inside was great. Plenty of room to stand and to put our Queen air mattress and 2 cots. Just very bummed about the lack of ease setting up and the materials breaking or ripping.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Huge tent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE tent! We are a family of 5 and there is so much room in this tent. It’s was incredibly easy to put up. It comes with nice metal stakes. I have to agree with other reviews about the pole being hard to instal in the door. It just doesn’t seem to fit. I also agree that you really don’t need it either. We have not used this tent in rain so I cannot comment on the dryness ability. It’s also a great color! I feel this was an amazing deal. Big tent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Leaks badly
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received originally has been returned due to something missing if I'm remembering correctly. But because this had such great reviews, we bought the same exact one at the store last year. 10 months later we finally got to go camping at Morrow Mountain this last weekend. It rained the whole time but it wasn't heavy. It leaked badly! On all corners. We have a 4yo and a 5yo and none of us slept well because of the leak. It made for a terrible experience!
customer_reviews.author: Emille

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad tent for the money. Wish the door worked completely.
customer_reviews.text: Tent itself is easy to set up, the rainfly is kinda of a pain to get on and set up. We used it on a rainy day/night, so we had the rainfly on. It did not leak, was a bit warm inside without much airflow, so as other reviews have mentioned, a fan is a wise purchase for this tent. The only complaint I have is that the zippered door-- the door shade on the inside does not zip all the way around, looks to be a manufacturere defect since the zipper tracks do not match in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent. good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent in the terms of size for the price. I love the color and I've always been a big fan of coleman. I'm really bummed that upon my first set up of my tent one of the poles shattered currently taped up and works fine but really disappointing. Otherwise great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Love the headroom and spaciousness inside, plus that swinging door is a great idea.
customer_reviews.text: Just my wife and I used it and we liked being able to stand up and change clothes in it. We're too old and got a few too many war wounds to get down and crawl into a low tent. The swinging door and spaciousness of this tent fits us well. I definitely would not say it's lightweight - maybe compared to something of some other fabric. It took the four of us ~20 minutes - reading instructions as we went along to get it up. Good value though. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sky210pilot

customer_reviews.title: Seven years and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now been using this tent for seven years. This thing has been in the rain and wind and it’s held up really well, never once had a leak. There is plenty of room for a family of four and the accompanying gear. We have exclusively done car camping. This last summer, 2019, I noticed some wear on one of the pole guide at the top of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Tent EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst tent ever made! Serious design flaws that allow TONS of water to pool and leak on the left and right sides... On a week long trip to SD we had water in the tent 3 times we fully tore it down and reset-up the tent multiple times to ensure that it was not something not setup correctly, but sure enough it leaked each time. Steer clear of this tent unless you like having all your stuff soaking wet while camping.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very large and sturdy. While using it, I have no concerns about rain/ dew. I really like the big D-shaped door with the rods in the edges so it swings and catches with velcro. Takes two people about 25 minutes to set up. My only complaint is that the elastic cords inside the poles is not very springy, so the poles pull apart easily. This is an issue with disassembly as you are trying to pull the poles back through the sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: InformedCitizen

customer_reviews.title: A great starter tent for a small family!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent- for the size and price it was perfect for me and my two kids. We used an Queen and Twin air mattress inside, but can easily fit 2 queens easily. Set up was easily accomplished between me and my 13-year old son. My only gripe- there are only 2 storage pockets inside the whole tent (which is suited for 8 people). But plenty of room for bags and whatever else you want to keep inside. Happy with this purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: melissamodern

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small family
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome! Easy to put together and take down; lovely quality; the bottom tarp-like fabric comes up around the edges by at least five inches, protecting campers from moisture leaking in from the bottom seams and tent sides... can fit about three air mattresses (twin) with room to spare. Prob could fit 6 people comfortably... any more than that would be crowded.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, reasonably easy to put up quickly, very spacious and lives up to the weatherproof claims.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this tent, the only thing I'd really change myself, would be to better reinforce the pole pockets, or do a better job of rounding the end caps of the tent poles which have to go through them. The only issues I've had is that one of those has become ripped and repairing those parts under continuous tension when the tent is up and where the poles still need to slide through is always a source of anxiety. Aside from that, the tent stays dry, the bathtub bottom comes a good distance off the ground and wind doesn't do a thing to this tent once you have all the guys staked out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Spicher

customer_reviews.title: Best Tent purchase EVER!
customer_reviews.text: As my headlines reads, this is the best tent money can buy! My boyfriend and I had a four-man tent that worked fine but we couldn't use our cot in it and there wasn't very much moving room to begin with. We decided to upgrade to have more room overall. It was the best decision. We can fit and assemble a two-person cot in this tent, with no issues, and we have plenty of walking room on top of it. My boyfriend, who is over 6 foot tall, can actually stand up straight in this tent. Well worth the money! Can't wait to take her out next year!
customer_reviews.author: akroyal_tlee

customer_reviews.title: Big, comfortable, and rain proof
customer_reviews.text: Our tent came and it was light enough for me to carry easily. My kids and I were able to put it together quickly. The tent is very roomy! I wasn't sure how weather proof it was after reading some reviews but it rained the first night we used it and everyone stayed completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multiple design flaws. This tent sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Multiple design flaws. Hard to set up unless you have 2 people. Door is hard to get in and out. Its massive. Roof is a screen and doesnt hold heat at night. Bad ventilation with window placement. No air circulation. Cant get a queen airbed blown up thru door. Unnecessary-poles for door. Must use rainfly. Not enough side pockets. This tent was prob never tested or used before production, buy 2 4 person tents instead of one 8 person tent. This tent sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: As a family of four, we needed a bigger tent so I bought this one. It definitely is bigger and we all fit comfortably inside. Each one of my kids has a slim but long sleeping pad, and my husband and I have a queen size inflatable mattress. All of it fit in the tent with room for our gear and room to spare. It definitely was a two person job to set up and I do wish it had either bigger windows or more of them for better air flow with the rain cover on. But other than that I was happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trying it for a second time
customer_reviews.text: Read many reviews for many brands and decided on this tent as cost effective balanced with quality. The first time we went camping, we set up the tent and I noticed two 2" long cuts in the floor of the tent. :( It rained that evening and water got in the tent from one of the corner seams. Seeing as how these are mass produced, things like this can happen so I am exchanging the tent. I will give it another go and write another review.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent but...............
customer_reviews.text: The tent is east to put up and take down(Getting back into bag is another story). Plenty of room for my family of four with two queen mattresses and a folding bench between the mattresses to serve as a table/nightstand. Have not had to deal with rain so can't speak to the weatherproof piece but why only three stars; there are only two small windows on the side and one on the door. It can get hot because not enough windows for a cross breeze. Overall, so far, a nice tent but could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: C Daley

customer_reviews.title: not as awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have owned Coleman tents for almost 20 years and this was our first disappointment. One of the poles was cracked out of the box and trusting Coleman we had not checked the tent quality before camping. We now own a broken tent I don’t love. The layout is very long and the pole placement was not as intuitive as other tents. I would not recommend this tent for beginners and I do advice checking all the parts before your adventure. I do always LOVE the self closing door!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: What is with the poles & cording?
customer_reviews.text: The tent is great I. All kinds of weather. My side that I found is that after camping trip #5, the poles have splintered and the elastic seems to be dry rotted. When trying to order replacement parts, there are no specific sizes to order and you have to take them back and try again. Very frustrating. No one seems to know why this occurs or how to get replacement parts. Love the tent itself, no rips or tears, solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice before ever being used
customer_reviews.text: The tent is large and fit two queen sleeping pads. We were excited about it but the first time it went up to waterproof the seams a pole snapped. We sent the tent back. Then the replacement tent went straight to the campsite. One of the poles had a bad weld that you could see before putting tent up. The weld released and the tent collapsed. I was able to keep the trip going by using Velcro zip ties and rubber bands to replace the metal tube. Coleman is not the quality it used to be. I’d stay away from their tents going forward
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: This tent poles split easy, Really need an aluminum type option.
customer_reviews.text: My first tents pole broke on first camping trip. We tried to replacement from Walmart and no instructions or ideas. So we taped broken poles, lots of fiberglass made us itch. Amazon sent a new replacement tent with a 30 warranty. Can't try tent for months. So may be stuck with finding a way to fix flimsy poles. We had wind and rain The tent did great. We saw little Dome tents crumble and blow away in our camp. Really need aluminum option.
customer_reviews.author: Sue-ba-roo

customer_reviews.title: bought for family
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my family in Puerto Rico when the earthquakes began. Large enough for four adults comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Ninadetusojos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a 4 night camping trip at various parks. It worked great! Putting it up and taking it down was easy after we figured it out the first time (I recommend a test run at home if you have the time). The Velcro door was a lifesaver! Kept bugs out without having to perpetually zip and unzip it. Plenty of room for the 6 people we had sleeping in it plus luggage etc. I'm looking forward to using it again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Zanne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect family tent
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assemble if you have at least 2 people. My 10 year old son and I got it up within 20 minutes or so. If you use every tie down and stake it well this tent isn't going anywhere. I wish it got a little better air flow but I'm extremely pleased with it and would highly recommend it. I fit a queen sized cot with air mattress on one side and still had ample room for sleeping bags, everything you need for a weekend camping trip and still have plenty of room for the kids to play board games if the weather gets to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was amazing!! Two queen size mattresses on each side. Put a 5x7 area rug in the middle. With a small folding table opposite the door for the small coffee maker, small electric heater, as it was early fall with cool nights. Had rain one night into morning. Everything dry!! Loved the over hang over the door. It was nice to be able to get out of tent and stay dry while closing door. The door and interior light were great! Can't wait for spring to come to go camping again!! Couldn't beat the price at the time either!!
customer_reviews.author: Colette W

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent for camping and the cover for the tent ripped apart allowing rain water into my tent... also, the bendable sticks to hold the front door open broke on day 3 of owning this tent... I will say the size of the tent was perfect.... but I’m not a happier camper with the overall workmanship of this tent
customer_reviews.author: big08mac

customer_reviews.title: Came with broken tent poles
customer_reviews.text: We got this tent thinking it would fit 8 people comfortably not packed in like sardines and no room for luggage or supplies. When we set it up at the campsite sadly one of the tent poles band came snapped, so couldn’t set the front of the tent up also the material is very cheap This tent would only last maybe a couple of trips before it started falling apart, also the design is bad because although long enough, the width is very narrow, you can barely fit two cots and two small air mattresses with kids. I do not recommend this tent at all!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Set up tent as soon as it was delivered. Since I'm an avid camper, set up was a breeze. The first thing I noticed was how huge this tent is. All of the tent poles and connectors are high quality and well made. The door feature was one of the reasons why I decided to purchase this tent and I love it. It works perfectly. The only thing that I am changing is the tent stakes. A little too wimpy. Other than that, I can't wait to use it next week for Memorial Day weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Jkalua

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: We did not have bad weather. Bought it for her friends to sleep in on her birthday at the back of our property and they really liked it. We are in southern Colorado at about 7000 ft. They stayed warm and lit it up by stringing lots of Christmas lights throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Condrey

customer_reviews.title: Standing room and more!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, awesome covered porch with rain hood, withstood winds well. Can see the stars through the roof net and may stand and walk around inside at 6.5ft high in center section and 5.5 on sides. Slightly difficult to squeeze a queen air mattress through the door, if not self-inflating. Tip: grey poles are not the X bars, black w/ red tape is the porch awning.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, roomy tent. Hinged door a bonus!
customer_reviews.text: A great, sturdy tent. It rained a bit during our trip but it stayed nice and dry on the inside. It was easy as pie to set up, the hinged door is fantastic, and it was not hard to take down (although who ever gets the tent back into it's original packaging?) Look forward to using it a lot more. Perfect for our family of four with a cot, twin and queen air mattresses. My only con is I wish it had more pockets to put stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for the money. It is spacious, fairly easy to put together, and holds up well in extreme weather. Despite some of the other reviews about not being waterproof, I did not have that issue. In fact, the first weekend I took it camping, it rained and hailed for a considerable amount of time while we were out there, and nothing got wet. I am very happy with this purchase, and look forward to using it more in the future! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GroBdeutschland

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: It is big. The works fantastically, and we love the night light. The door thing is much easier than dealing with a limp piece of fabric, although you still need to zip it, as the Velcro doesn't keep it closed all the way. Fairly easy to set up and take down. True to height. It will need to be waterproofed and wax on the seems. The reasons why I giving it 3 stars is there is no storage in it and no way to roll the window flaps up. So they hang there, or you zip them up. Overall a great tent and was great for our trip, except those minor annoying things to me. Happy camping all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: So much room! It was as so nice to be able to stand up. Make the camping trip much better. We had two twin mattresses and a TV in there haha. Wish the doorway was down a little more for the older dog to get in but if it rains I will probably be happy about that. Edit. Not so happy. Only used once and the draw strings in the poles are broken like the draw strings were old. An hour drive and can't set up our tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: This tent was easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this tent for several years now, and have used it on over 15 camping trips. This summer we (myself, hubby, plus our 6 kids, 5-17 years old) traveled the Midwest on an adventure that had us packing up camp everyday and relocating to a new destination. This tent was easy to put up, easy to take down, roll up, and put back in the bag. We have never experienced leaks, even in rainy weather. I do suggest replacing the tent stakes with a bigger set... just makes it easier to pull out when your finished. It also does a great job keeping creepy crawlers out!
customer_reviews.author: marybethmommyof6

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for multiple people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for a camping weekend with 4 other people. We managed to fit 5 twin size air mattresses in it snuggly. It was easy to setup, with only a little confusion on the rainfly. It comes out enough to cover the outside of the door from the rain. Had a bit of a surprise 2inch rainfall storm come through and we made it through without getting wet. Overall it was a good tent that was easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Like a sieve.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purposely waited for my daughter’s family to log a couple of Summer’s worth of nights in this tent. The price is right, but as usual you get what you pay for. On drizzly backyard nights, even after seam-sealing annually, this thing leaks. Though it pitches easily enough and is plenty big for two adults and four young boys, it is being replaced by Santa this Christmas (and NOT with another Coleman tent!). Don’t waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nomadman

customer_reviews.title: Rain fly is NOT waterproof!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Second time used and I’m sitting in a wet tent after a very light rain. The entire rain fly is no longer waterproof. We had to pull a tarp over the tent for the thunderstorm coming in two hours. It was an awesome tent the first time we used it, surviving a literal downpour. Why it is no longer waterproof is beyond me, but I’m more concerned with drying everything off on every inch of floor space.
customer_reviews.author: Average Polack

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste ur money
customer_reviews.text: This tent leaked on us the first time we used it.... So I put some waetherproofing stuff on th e seams... The next time we took it out there was a wind storm and 3 of our rods broke. Very disappointed. I thought Coleman was a trusted name that backed their products
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Rust

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the tent itself, but the instructions are awful. The instructions to assemble it aren't bad, but the poles aren't clearly marked. The instructions to take it down and fold it up are non-existent, and I had to go to YouTube and watch videos by a few other people to figure out how to get it packed small enough to fit back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Oliveri

customer_reviews.title: Not quite wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Tent was a little hard to setup, not quite wide enough for queen air mattress and the rain fly could use a redesign. Good quality with the one I recieved. It kept most of the rain out but never the less some water got in side the tent. I think it was because the air mattress and sleep gear were touching side wall where it was just to narrow and couldn't be helped. Another foot wide and foot foot shorter in length would be an awesome footprint. Anyway I'm returning the tent to find one that better suits my space and waterproofing needs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.  Tapered ends made it so the queen airbed had to be close to the middle of the tent
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it in the rain yet, but it went together easy with clear instructions and we were happy with it. It is tapered on both ends so we were not able to get a queen air bed on the end (we used Intex extra height), so I know I can't get 3 queen size ones in there like the package says. Maybe a cheaper brand of airbed that isn't as tall, but I dont know. But we didn't have a need for 3 so it works for our needs
customer_reviews.author: DavinaW

customer_reviews.title: I can't say how good it is in a big rain because we did ...
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy tent for two queen size mattresses. Acutely it can fit even three but then it would be no room to walk around or store stuff. I can't say how good it is in a big rain because we did not experianced that yet. So far we used it for 3 trips and it is holding up bery well no rips or tears yet. I am giving it 4 stars only because it need more windows. Ventilation in this tent is very poor. But for 130 or so dollars i think it is good tent. Everyone complaining about some minor stuf remember you did not pay 500 dollars for it.
customer_reviews.author: Gytis Stankevicius

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed tent and large comfortable interior area with nice sky view through the mesh cover.
customer_reviews.text: Tent is excellent in both form and function. The tent took us a bit of time to set up the first time but it was relatively easy and could ideally be set up in 15-20 minutes thereafter. It housed us comfortably during a five-day camping trip and withstood a day-and-a-half of heavy rain, thunder, and wind. There is plenty of room inside for a queen mattress and at least three occupants. With the tent fly off and the tent's underlying mesh cover, there is an expansive view of the skyline while keeping out bothersome mosquitoes and flies.
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and take down. We added a water spray on guard. Plenty of room for I would say 6 and gear. I am new to camping and was told that tents normally accommodate a less number of people then advertised comfortably. This tent provides lots of room for us and our dog, with room to spare in case of inclement weather to be shared with others and have room to move.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of pro's, one con
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE! And it's surprisingly easy to set up. We fit a queen sized air bed and a medium kennel in ours with more than enough room to walk around, stow gear, and stand up. My only complaint is in the construction of the sides of the tent, unfortunately there's really no support or guidelines to keep the sides from sort of "falling" into the tent. This made sleeping a bit difficult as the sides tend to rest on your forehead and you risk waking up to a wet mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Miller

customer_reviews.title: One of the poles broke after only two uses
customer_reviews.text: This tent is large and relatively easy to put together. However, it is not durable. We used this tent for one night when first purchased three years ago. We stored the tent, clean, in a weatherproof area of our house so there was no heat or cold damage. We used the tent again this weekend, for a two-day camping trip. One of the poles broke -- the internal string -- as we were taking the tent down. That is ridiculous. Now I have to figure out how to find a replacement pole. Three nights and this tent is no longer usable.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge! So much space if you have 2 people and a dog. I’d say it can comfortably fit 4 people. 8 would be tight fit. But this is definitely a summer tent. Took it up at about 4000ft during November in Ojai and it was freeeezzzing. But at ground level it was totally perfect and nice.
customer_reviews.author: j ken

customer_reviews.title: Great very spacious tent.
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy this tent! Super spacious and easily fit a queen and 2 kids air mattresses with room for all our bags. Quick set up. A pole actually broke as we put it up to test it out in our basement and their costumer service mailed me a replacement pole within 72 hours! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality construction and features, thin floor tears easily.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, easy setup with minimal poles, definitely one-person do-able. My issues are with the very cheap quality stakes (I didn't expect much) and the floor material is extremely thin. After one night stay in the California desert (small sharp rocks) I had several holes in the bottom, so now it is no longer water proof. Everyone told me to put a tarp down first but I was confident that the bottom was able to keep us dry in case of sudden monsoon downpour. I wish I had done that to protect the bottom not from water but the sharp stuff. So unless you are setting this tent on a nice grass meadow, get a tarp to protect the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: j. trost

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: We got the 8 person- 7 of us but sleeps comfortably for sure even with a couple of air mattresses. My 11 year old sets up by himself (with help of an 8 year old lol) but he is somewhat precocious. If you have basic tens skills should be fine. Like the design- we have only used a few times so far but no issues. Seems sturdy and I especially love the sturdy and tangle free door zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Slade

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and poles break.
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the bad reviews and trusted the Coleman name. Big mistake. The tent leaked like a sieve the first time we put it up. I treated the seams and it was better, but still leaked the second time. The third time, two poles started to split and a third snapped completely in half. We got two uses out of this tent, both of which were cut short due to wet sleeping bags because of the leaks. I have always had Coleman tents - never again!
customer_reviews.author: JTP

customer_reviews.title: Lost for words.
customer_reviews.text: I have sent it back twice, it has no air circulation and after 35 years with Coleman tents this has been the worst. It didn't do well in the wind even with the 12 inch pins. I would return this one if i could.
customer_reviews.author: Danney Boren

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: That tent has a lot of space !! Awesome, we did a trial run in the backyard and that helped to figure out the assembly. It’s a bit confusing at first but then all makes sense and I’m confident when we go camping that thing is up and running in no time. The roof is basically detachable. If it’s off both end parts of the tent have a sky view (just mosquito net ).
customer_reviews.author: supp

customer_reviews.title: A nice tent well designed maybe could have had a window
customer_reviews.text: Can be set up by a couple of people in 10 minutes or less. We had 2 queen air mattress inside plus a twin with about 3 feet to spare, 2 persons per queen 1 on twin, you do the math. That said used first weekend in the rain nothing nothing got wet inside. A nice tent well designed maybe could have had a window, in the rear wall, but I would buy it again, large roomy standing changing room. It also can be put back in the bag, just take pictures of how it was packed as you remove it from the bag and unroll it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good tent
customer_reviews.text: We recently got stuck in some nasty rain, our entire campsite flooded. This tent stayed completely dry! I could not have been more impressed, not a single drop of water inside. We are overall very happy with this tent. Our only complaint is the front door. It is overly complicated to zip and unzip and the Velcro is ineffective. It is clever that it swings open but does not stay shut with the Velcro. Our two kids have a difficult time figuring out which zipper to get in and out. Overall a good tent for the price
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent to use as a backup for sleeping at our cabin. The measurements were perfect for the space I had. It was easy to set up and take down and SO spacious! We had three twin mattresses in there with tons of room to walk around. Like other reviewers have mentioned, it would be nice to have a venting window at the back of the tent, but overall, just a fabulous tent!
customer_reviews.author: GLENNA ROSE RITT

customer_reviews.title: Water proof!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. So we went camping during the damn hurricane Laura so we had one night of huge storms and tons of rains. We did not get any drops of rain whatsoever in the tent! I will never buy another brand. As long as you stake the tent and put the tarp on correctly it will be your best tent!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Lights and power cartridge was not included
customer_reviews.text: Where is it? CPX LED lights that provide 100 lumens of illumination. The lighting system can be powered by four D batteries (sold separately) or the included CPX 6 rechargeable power cartridge and comes with an energy pack that can power virtually anything with a USB slot. This was not included, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: william Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: We had a summer storm that lasted about 10 minutes with wind and rain. One of the tents in our group collapsed. This tent did retain its structure, but the rain protection cover does not cover sufficiently. You really have to stretch it to get it to fit over the ends of the tent, which means that if the wind pushes the tent, the rain cover pops out of place and the tent floods. Any mattress on the edges of the tent was soaked and sitting in a puddle by the end of the 10 minute storm. Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Weather proofing
customer_reviews.text: Sad for Coleman - their manufacturer has failed to uphold their weather standards. We camped within one week of receiving the tent - easy set up, liked the functions of the tent. It rained and we were on a raised platform. The floor leaked so much we had to get out in the rain and trench around the platform - not a dry towel in the tent. Lucky for us we have an inflatable air mattress and had a table inside so we could put things off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No USB charging port
customer_reviews.text: The description reads "comes with an energy pack that can power virtually anything with a USB slot". However, the charging pack does not come with a USB slot (even though the manual shows one as well). I reached out to Coleman and they told me "we do not change the manual each time we change a part. We do not offer the ones with the USB and we have not for some time now." They are unwilling to do anything and told me to return the tent to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DBailey

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent in 2016 and have used it 4 times since then. Last year I noticed water dripping into the tent at a single point through the rain fly. This year there were multiple leaks in the rain fly, and the sides of the tent began letting water in as well. It’s now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSky79

customer_reviews.title: Pandemic gets closer than comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was as expected, 2stars. Except - that during a global pandemic, we found a very dirty mask, yes a mask like the ones we're told to wear to keep others safe from us. Once I stifled the urge to set the whole thing a blaze, we sprayed everything with lysol and called it a day for camping. I will think again before buying used items.
customer_reviews.author: M. West

customer_reviews.title: Missing a sewn part to tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent 1 yr ago to the day. It has been stored. When I went to assemble it, there is a complete piece missing that secures one of the main cross rods to the tent in the rear right side. The strap with the key ring and retaining pins that is supposed to be sewn on is completely missing. It was very disappointing to say the least. I’m not sure if this is refundable but now we have to wait for another day to go camping.
customer_reviews.author: Sly O.

customer_reviews.title: great tent
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old tent finally bit the dust, so it was time to purchase a new one. After searching at several local stores and online for available tents, my husband and I decided to purchase this Coleman tent. Easy set up and take down and was very spacious for our children and their gear. Very sturdy and the material was a great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C

product_meta.title: Coleman 8-Person Tent for Camping | Montana Tent with Easy Setup
product_meta.description: Style:Tent| Size:8-Person| Color:GreenSet up a home base with some extra sleeping space with the Coleman Montana 8-Person Tent. An extended door awning creates a dry space to store gear and enter the tent. If it rains, the included rainfly and the WeatherTec system with its patented welded floors and inverted seams will help you stay dry. Additionally, angled windows, which you can keep open in the rain, help keep the water out while allowing for extra air circulation. Setup is simple with snag-free, continuous pole sleeves and the patented pin-and-ring system. A hinged door makes for easy comings and goings. Inside, there's enough room to stretch out on three queen-sized airbeds, and storage pockets help to keep small items organized. When it's time to head home, the tent easily packs up into an expandable carry bag with a rip strip until you're off on your next adventure.
feature_bullets: Weatherproof: Welded corners and inverted seams keep water from getting in; included rainfly offers extra weather protection
Hinged door: Easily swings open and includes an extended awning
Storage pockets: Keep small gear organized and off the floor
Conventional pitch: Sets up in 15 minutes
Roomy interior: 16 x 7 ft. With 6 ft. 2 in. Center height; fits 3 queen-size air beds
Carry bag: Included for easy storage

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,061 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
